I have adhd as well and Iâ€™m learning to deal with this anger too. Itâ€™s awful because my abuser would make me feel bad for being angry and tell me that I was a bad person and there was nothing good about me. I hate that his thoughts stuck to my subconscious because when I do feel angry I feel bad because itâ€™s like â€˜heâ€™s right, I do have anger issuesâ€™ then I get angry and think â€˜well Iâ€™m angry at HIM because he did this to meâ€™ and then itâ€™s just a huge spiral of hate. Heâ€™s off living in a new state, in a new church where heâ€™s super involved and everyone seems to love him. Itâ€™s infuriating that he abused me, got away with it and then now is starting off new. And not only that, because heâ€™s doing well and said heâ€™s sorry that I experienced that side of him it makes me want to gaslight myself and feel like Iâ€™m the bad guy because obviously if he was the bad guy he wouldnâ€™t be doing well. And then i get angry all over again that Iâ€™m traumatized. 
So what helps: 
Meditation for 15 minutes on gratitude and what I love about myself 
Talking myself through my emotions and why I feel them and self soothing 
Writing what I feel and thinking down and songwriting 
Deciding that I canâ€™t get back the past. I shouldnâ€™t compare my life to his, and I need to focus on what I need to do for myself. This doesnâ€™t actually help the anger but it does help me get my life together. 
Spending time with friends and going out 
Making new memories 
Being outside. I love to garden so that helps. 
Be around animals and children if possible 
Reminding myself that I still have the rest of my life and if I let go of seeking revenge and wanting them to suffer then I can move forward almost unscathed from this 
Forgiveness is really difficult for me but Iâ€™m trying to, for myself. The anger eats me alive and itâ€™s not fair to me. What happened isnâ€™t fair. Life isnâ€™t fair. I can either push myself to keep going or I can die stuck and angry. 
Let yourself be angry but also gain the skills it takes to self soothe.
